Error analysis

Error_function(function, variables)

Function to determine the error of a function based on the errros of the variables of that function.

Parameters

function – A sympy expression of which the error function should be determined

Returns

A sympy expression of the error function

Return type

sympy.core.add.Add

Example:

from PToolkit import Error_function
import sympy as sy

I, R = sy.symbols("I, R")
V = I*R

error = Error_function(V, [I, R])

The outpur of the code:

\[\Delta V = \sqrt{\left|{I}\right|^{2} \left|{\Delta R}\right|^{2} + \left|{R}\right|^{2} \left|{\Delta I}\right|^{2}}\]
Round_sigfig(x, fig, type_rounding='Normal', format='numerical')

Function to determine the error of a function based on the errros of the variables of that function. This function also works with numpy arrays

Parameters

  • x – A float that needs to be rounded

  • fig – The number of significant digits

  • type – The type of rounding: “Normal” rounds to the closest number, “Up” rounds up, “Down” rounds down

  • format – Unused param

Returns

A number rounded to a n significant digits

Return type

float

Standaard_error_per_index(*arrays)

Function to calculate the Standaard error per index. Given n arrays the standaard error will be calculated using the ithe elements of the given arrays.

Parameters

arrays – n amount of numpy arrays

Returns

The standaard error of each index

Return type

np.array
